tool.name: SOAPdenovo2_contig
tool.description: SOAPdenovo is a novel short-read assembly method that can build a de novo draft assembly for the human-sized genomes. The program is specially designed to assemble Illumina GA short reads.
tool.command:
#if $select_tool=127 SOAPdenovo-127mer #end if #if $select_tool=63 SOAPdenovo-63mer #end if contig -g "$input1" $resolve_repeats #if $merge_level -M $merge_level #end if #if $cov_cutoff -D $cov_cutoff #end if #if $arc_weight -e $arc_weight #end if #if $max_kmer -m $max_kmer -s $reads_info_file -p $number_cpu #if $merge_bubble -E $merge_bubble #end if
#end if

param.name: resolve_repeats
param.label: Resolve repeats
param.help: resolve repeats using information generated in pregraph step, works only if -R is set in pregraph step too

param.name: merge_level
param.label: Merge level
param.help: the strength of merging similar sequences during contiging, between 0 and 3

param.name: cov_cutoff
param.label: Edge coverage cutoff
param.help: edges shorter than (2*K+1) with coverage no larger than EdgeCovCutoff will be deleted

param.name: arc_weight
param.label: Arc weight
param.help: two edges, between which the arc's weight is larger than arcWeight, will be linerized

param.name: max_kmer
param.label: max k when using multi-kmer
param.help: max k when using multi-kmer, and the parameters below are used along with multi-kmer

param.name: reads_info_file
param.label: Reads info file
param.help: The file contains information of solexa reads(It's necessary when using multi-kmer)

param.name: merge_bubble
param.label: merge clean bubble
param.help: merge clean bubble before iterate, works only if -M is set when using multi-kmer

tool.help:
Version 2.04: released on July 13th, 2012 Compile Jul 9 2013 11:57:30
******************** Contig ********************
Parameters: contig
contig -g InputGraph [-R] [-M mergeLevel -D EdgeCovCutoff] [-s readsInfoFile -m maxkmer -p n_cpu -r] -g <string> inputGraph: prefix of input graph file names -R (optional) resolve repeats using information generated in pregraph step, works only if -R is set in pregraph step too, [NO] -M <int> mergeLevel(min 0, max 3): the strength of merging similar sequences during contiging, [1] -D <int> EdgeCovCutoff: edges shorter than (2*K+1) with coverage no larger than EdgeCovCutoff will be deleted, [1] -e <int> arcWeight: two edges, between which the arc's weight is larger than arcWeight, will be linerized, [0] -m <int> max k when using multi-kmer, and the parameters below are used along with multi-kmer, [NO] -s <string> readsInfoFile:The file contains information of solexa reads(It's necessary when using multi-kmer) -p <int> number of cpu, [8] -E (optional) merge clean bubble before iterate, works only if -M is set when using multi-kmer, [NO]
